entry.title: CHECKSIGFROMSTACK/{Verify} BIP for Bitcoin
entry.summary: A member of the Bitcoin community, named Jeremy Rubin, recently questioned the usefulness of CHECKSIGFROMSTACKADD, as it is not bound to txdata. Furthermore, he requested a more detailed explanation of the BIP's design process. Additionally, he inquired about specific applications for !=32 arguments and whether or not 0-520 byte arguments can be safely used. Lastly, he expressed interest in discussing topics related to feature compatibility and the potential benefits of splitting R/S without CAT.
